questions.question: What does 'open' in open source mean?
questions.answer: It means anyone can look at and use the code.

questions.question: Who writes open-source software?
questions.answer: People all over the world alone or in teams.

questions.question: Is open-source software always free of cost?
Can you use open source without internet?
What is a popular open-source phone system?
What is closed-source software?
questions.answer: Software you cant see or change the code.

questions.question: Can open source help you learn programming?
Can you build your own app with open source?
Can open-source software be used at work?
Can teachers use open-source software in class?
Can open source be used in government?
Whats an example of open-source learning tool?
Can open source be used for games?
Can you make your own open-source software?
Where can you share open-source code?
What is a 'fork' in open source?
questions.answer: Making your own copy of a project.

questions.question: What is a 'pull request'?
questions.answer: Asking to add your changes to a project.

questions.question: What is a 'README' file?
questions.answer: A file that explains what a project does.

questions.question: What is open-source documentation?
questions.answer: Notes that explain how to use the code.

questions.question: Why are comments in code useful?
Should you read the license first?
Can you help without writing code?
Can you ask for help in open source?
What is an issue tracker?
questions.answer: A place to report bugs or suggest features.

questions.question: Whats a code contributor?
questions.answer: Someone who adds to the project.

questions.question: Whats a maintainer?
questions.answer: A person who manages the project.
